text:
I have added element "Save Responses to a File" in my Test Plan but only the 
log-in page seems to be saved to a file.
creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us

text:
The Save Responses element only saves responses in its scope.

Please a sample test plan as an attachment.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Created attachment 11342
A test plan in which there is a "Save Responses to a File" - should it be positioned elsewhere in the plan?
creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
sebb@apache.org
text:
The placement looks OK, but I'll need to try it out to check.

The Once-only controller does not look right - there's mo Sampler.

Were there any error messages in jmeter.log?

Just tried a test. 
I changed the HTTP default to localhost, and ran against a local version of 
Tomcat.

The test produced several files with names starting "saveme" - but there does 
seem to be a bug in the automatically generated file names, as they are of the 
form:

saveme<n>.html;charset=ISO-8859-1

where n=2,3...14. (numbers 1 and 8 are missing)

There are also a couple of NPEs in the log file, which probably correspond to 
the two missing files.

There's obviously a problem here, which I'll try and sort out soon (I wrote the 
test element originally).

It would be useful to know if you get any sample* files - or perhaps there are 
14 NPEs or other errors in jmeter.log? Perhaps you could attach jmeter.log as 
well?
creator: sebb@apache.org
sebb@apache.org
text:
Thanks (you seem to have posted jmeter-test.log instead of jmeter.log, but 
hopefully I don't need jmeter.log).

Found (and hopefuly fixed) some bugs - at least when tested against Tomcat.

The fixes should appear in the nightly builds in a day or so.

Leaving the call open until tested by the originator.

Just realised that the Gump builds won't pick up the change in CVS until it is 
merged onto the main branch. [I made the change in the 2.0 branch].

So I've put a copy of an updated 2.0.0 Jar file at the following URL:

http://www.apache.org/~sebb/jars

Worked for me in limited testing, but no guarantees!
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Now there is an extension to the SavedResponses file called .plain and an error 
occurs when I try to open and read it.
creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
sebb@apache.org
text:
What error is reported? 
What application are you using to open the file with?
What OS are you running on?

creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
text:
I reported this error about not being able to get all saved responses on my 
Test Plan - only the log in page was saved.  Now I cannot open any saved 
document - it looks as if it should be able to open in Acrobat.  Os - Windows 
2000,Error - "There was an error reading this document.  A file read error has 
occurred"

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
It's unlikely that Acrobat will be able to read (m)any of the saved files.

Files with the extension .plain should be plain text files; i.e. the content 
type was specified as text/plain.

Try opening the files in a text editor, e.g. Notepad, instead.

If necessary, rename the file as .txt and try opening it.

The files show nothing whether they are saved as .txt or anything else I can 
find.
I'm attaching one of the of the files.I've now tried several times to create 
attachment, but somehow it get taken out of box when I hit "submit".
creator: Shelley.Schribman@state.ma.us
